intro: Glaucium flavum f. obtusilobum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved whitlow grass, is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, bluish-green leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. This variety is distinguished by its obtuse leaf lobes, which set it apart from other forms of Glaucium flavum.
